title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or YOUR COMPANY is HIRING:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**The Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings.**

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=dab56a83877ffe7dc6fd93767a8f63e9c366e592
comments:
Skills : Android, Data Visualisation, Python, Java, Firebase, AI
Protfolio :AI, ML
Location : Delhi, Bangalore, Chandigarh, J and K
Contact : Email /DM

So one thing I've been trying to get a good grasp on lately is comp ranges. I know 1.6lpm is a big meme here and all, but lacking something like levels.fyi I'm having a hard time understanding what's a reasonable target to negotiate for. It kind of bit me when I was negotiating recently and I went slightly above what they considered reasonable. It's fine and all, and I ended up getting a good deal anyway, but I wanted to know what kind of comp ranges are "expected" for different experience levels. Thanks in advance!

Hiring! Looking for candidates with Oracle database, Postgres, XML or web application servers experience from a computer science or engineering educational background.
Location: Gurgaon
DM me for more details. Thanks
are you recruiting or showcasing your skills?

First-generation litigating lawyer. Possess about 10 years experience in civil, mercantile litigation.  Based out of New Delhi and have recently gone into independent practice w.e.f. May 2020. I am looking out for retainerships with private entities and organisations having disputes related work, as well as general legal advisory work which they may wish to outsource. On an unrelated note, I am also very keen to work, even on a pro bono basis, in the field of animal conservation and environmental preservation. Please DM me if anyone can assist. Thanks.
It would be useful if you mention your field and years of experience etc
Software, 2 years, but I meant more in general - like what is the expectation for someone with ~5, 10 etc. Sort of like what levels.fyi does.

There isn't a general hard number. Every company has their range/band for a specific position. 

For Software Development Engineer - in Infosys it may be 4-6 lakhs for 2 years. For Microsoft it may be 18-26 lakhs.

Which companies are you targeting?
Use Glassdoor for this

Go on glass door or payscale.com and search for what your designation in the company you are applying for. It helps if the position has mass hiring as there are multiple data points to consider.

Take the median and quote about 30% higher than that. In India and almost everywhere the Recruiters try to get you to commit a figure first. That ideally puts you at a disadvantage while negotiating. This method of quoting a figure higher than their expectation actually will turn them on their head. Also, make sure you know how much you think you are worth. If you think, you should be making 1L per month (and glassdoor is in a similar range) then make sure you stick to that number.

In a successful negotiation, both parties will always come out feeling they could have gotten more.
I have the same profile looking for jobs in Thane/Bhiwandi location

I generally target working for small to mid sized startups, and for companies like that there just isn't reliable salary data on Glassdoor. I try to calibrate with what bigger companies offer, but my expectation is that a VC backed startup should be paying slightly above market, so I wanted to see what others have seen in that kind of environment.
As mentioned in a sibling comment, small to mid sized startups, usually funded.
People who left their jobs without paying bond and without getting the relieving letter, did you ever face difficulty in your career later on in life?
Pinging people on LinkedIn and hoping they disclose salary to random strangers is your best bet ðŸ˜‚
Interested... what's the job profile?

Hey folks, anyone settled in Germany or know about Germany, how to pursue Higher studies after completing B. Tech from Kerala, I wanted to know the possibilities and what are the procedures for that.
P. S : Much appreciated for your time

Looking for job in Procurement:

1. 2.8 years of experience in end-to-end procurement (SAP MM)
2. Location: Bengaluru
3. Contact: DM/mail
Check youtube, there are lot of videos on this topic
Can anyone tell me what SAP MM stream is? I got it as my stream in MNC, is there any future for this stream?
My company is hiring devs with Java and python experience. Big fintech. DM for deets.
VC backed companies used to pay higher. Now everyone wants to be "competitive" after softbank has had to scale down.
Obviously showcasing my skills, please refer to template provided.
Looking for bloggers/content writers for a personal project. This is not going to be regular agency-kind pay. So looking for someone who wants some pocket money on the sides.
"Why are you booing me, I'm right"
